description: Internal and external alterations and the retained use of a retail shop and former restaurant, including the installation of 2 new shopfronts and front entrance to upper floors and construction of first and second floor rear extensions and creation of a third floor within roofspace and rear extension in conjunction with the formation of 12 residential units (10 x 1 bedroom, 1 x 2 bedroomand a one-bedroom maisonette), provision of 1st, 2nd and 3rd floor terraces, ground floor cycle parking and refuse storage and disabled parking space to rear
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun either before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 	1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces including obscured glazing as shown on the approved plans of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details and retained hereafter.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings and to protect privacy in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004). | The obscure privacy screens as identified on the approved plans all shall be no less that 1.8 metres in height when measured from the finished floor level of the terrace that they relate to and shall be implemented prior to first occupation and shall be permanently retained.  Reason:  To prevent overlooking from the subject sites terraces in order to safeguard the amenities of the residents of 46 and 56 The Broadway in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004). | The refuse and recycling bin stores shown on the approved drawings shall be provided before commencement of the use and thereafter retained for the duration of the use.  Reason: To ensure that adequate provision for refuse storage is made within the site and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004). | Details of energy efficient design and consideration of on-site equipment for renewable power generation for the buildings shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and the details approved shall be so implemented prior to first occupation of any of the buildings or accommodation in the development and maintained thereafter for the life of the development.  Reason: To ensure that the buildings are in accordance with Policy 2.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004). | Before the development is commenced, details of any external lighting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The lighting shall thereafter be provided and maintained solely in accordance with the approved details.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policy 4.12 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004). | Notwithstanding the parking area shown on the approved plans drawing number 489/101 dated April 2007, details of access, loading and parking arrangements shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development and that the this area shall laid out and market prior to first occupation of any of the flats hereby permitted and permanently retained without obstruction and retained hereafter.  Reason: To provide adequate parking facilities, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004). | No development shall commence until details of a site construction method statement/management plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:  -	on-site construction worker parking -	anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site -	delivery times (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods) -	dust suppression measures -	wheel washing provisions -	site security -	vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear. -	procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents -	details of how the temporary vehicular access road will be removed and re-instated, and the timing of such works -	storage of construction materials -	siting and location of any site offices  Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  Reason:  In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004). | The deposition and collection of refuse within the application site shall be restricted to 0700 - 2100 hrs Monday to Sunday.  A sign informing users of these hours shall be affixed near the entrance to refuse area.  Reason: To ensure highway safety in nearby roads and to protect living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11, 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004). | The proposed cycle storage areas as shown on the approved plans shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained hereafter.  Reason:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with policy 9.6 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004) | No machinery, plant, openings or ducts shall be installed on any elevations without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby occupiers in accordance with policy 4.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004). | Before any works commence on site, details of a scheme that complies with the aims and objectives of the Police requirements of 'Secured by Design' shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  	Reason: To ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements as detailed by ODPM's Planning Policy Statement 1: Delivering Sustainable Development, and with the requirements of Clause 17 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 which imposes a duty on a Local Authority 'to do all that it can to prevent crime and disorder in its area'. | The development will be affected by traffic and aircraft noise at a level, which falls into Category D noise exposure, and also building services noise.  Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms, gardens and balconies from external noise. The criteria to be met and the assessment method shall be that specified at Document 5.3 "Guidance for developers".  The details shall also include alternative means of ventilation for noise sensitive rooms, meeting the said criteria. The works, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason:  In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 "Noise and Development". | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  Reason:  In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 "Noise and Development". | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, for the installation, operation, and maintenance of the best practicable odour abatement equipment including an extract system, the height of the discharge, and the efflux velocity of the effluent at the point of discharge.  The system, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained and maintained.  Reason:  In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 2.6 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004. | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the dwelling above to demonstrate that an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 Leq 5mins, (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5mins, (one-third octaves) will be met inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq,5mins (octaves), 0r NR 25 Leq,5mins (one-third octaves), inside a living room when noise is generated from the commercial use.  REASON:  In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 "Noise and Development". | Areas shown on the approved plans as parking, access, loading, unloading and manoeuvring areas shall be kept clear and unobstructed at all times and used for these purposes only.  Reason: To ensure that adequate parking and servicing space is available within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the Council's adopted the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004. | 	The A3 uses hereby permitted shall not operate outside the hours of 1100 -2300hrs Monday to Saturday, and 1100 - 2230 hrs on Sundays and Bank or Public Holidays.   Reason:  In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 4.4 and 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004. | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with policy 5.3 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004).
